summary: John Peacock has named his squad for next month 's UEFA European Under-17 Championship . The Young Lions are the defending champions , having beaten Holland on penalties in the final last year . They have been placed in Group D alongside Holland , Italy and the Republic of Ireland .

aspect: 1. England's Under-17 squad has been named for the UEFA European Championship in Bulgaria.
2. Chelsea's Jay Dasilva and Arsenal's Stephy Mavididi are among the talented young players from Premier League clubs included in the squad.
3. Liverpool duo Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold have been recalled after missing the Elite Round of qualifiers.
4. The Young Lions are defending champions and have a 100% record in qualifying.
5. England will face Italy in their opening match on May 7.
6. The squad also includes players like Danny Collinge, Reece Oxford, Easah Suliman, James Yates, Marcus Edwards, and Chris Willock.

This means that the defending champions, the England Under-17 team, have some highly talented and skilled players in their squad for the upcoming UEFA European Under-17 Championship.
